instructions.1: To make blood orange sauce, in a 10- to 12-inch nonstick frying pan over high heat, mix orange juice, sugar, garlic, ginger, and chili flakes to taste. Boil until reduced to 1 cup, about 10 minutes; stir often.
instructions.2: Meanwhile, rinse chicken, pat dry, and cut into 1/2-inch chunks.
instructions.3: In a 12-inch nonstick frying pan or a 5- to 6-quart nonstick pan over high heat, stir chicken in oil until lightly browned and no longer pink in center of thickest part (cut to test), 4 to 5 minutes.
instructions.4: Add blood orange sauce and stir until boiling, 1 to 2 minutes.
instructions.5: Spoon chicken and sauce onto rice. Sprinkle with green onions and season to taste with soy sauce.

questions.question: In Step 5, is the chicken from Step 2 being used?
Is chicken from Step 2 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is blood orange sauce from Step 1 still available in Step 4?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 3?
If we skip Step 2, is it still valid to stir the chicken in Step 3?
Can we make (Step 1) and spoon (Step 5) at the same time?
